meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect the soldered joints of (something)
meanings.sent1: He carefully unsolders the wires to fix the broken circuit.
meanings.sent2: The technician unsolders the old connections to replace them with new ones.
meanings.sent3: The robot unsolders its own parts to upgrade itself.
meanings.sent4: She unsolders the past mistakes to start fresh.
meanings.sent5: The magician unsolders the metal rings with a wave of his hand.

meanings.sent1: Dad unsolders the metal pieces to reuse them for his project.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler unsolders the gemstone setting to reset it in a new design.
meanings.sent3: The chef unsolders the burnt pan to salvage the meal.
meanings.sent4: The artist unsolders the old sculpture to create a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic unsolders the damaged part to replace it with a shiny new one.
